name: Fitness App - JTBD Job Discovery
description: Jobs to Be Done discovery phase for a fitness tracking app

inputs.context: Mobile fitness app in a crowded market. Competing with MyFitnessPal, Strava, Apple Fitness. Looking for differentiation through better understanding of customer jobs.
inputs.researchData: User interviews and surveys (n=50): 1) 70% download fitness apps but stop using within 2 weeks, 2) Logging food is 'too much work', 3) Progress feels invisible day-to-day, 4) Motivation drops when results plateau, 5) Social comparison demotivates more than motivates, 6) Want accountability without judgment, 7) Exercise alone feels boring and hard to sustain.

mainJobs: Stay motivated to exercise when progress feels invisible
Hold myself accountable without feeling judged or compared
Make exercise feel less boring and isolating
relatedJobs: Track progress to see if my efforts are working
Get credit for small wins that aren't reflected on the scale
Find workout buddies with similar goals and schedules
struggles: Scale doesn't move even though I'm working hard - feels demotivating
Logging everything I eat feels like homework
Comparing my progress to fitness influencers makes me want to quit
Hard to stay motivated when exercising alone
Don't know if my workout routine is actually working
switchingTriggers: Plateau: 'I've been working out for a month but scale hasn't moved'
Comparison: 'Seeing everyone's perfect gym selfies makes me feel worse'
Isolation: 'I need someone to hold me accountable but don't have anyone'
Complexity: 'Logging every meal is too much work - I just stopped'
